src:
Vučić: Dijalog sa Prištinom za dva tri meseca. Palmer: Radićemo na proširenju EU

04 Nov 2019, 10:20

Predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić izjavio je da veruje da će uskoro, za dva ili tri meseca, biti nastavljen dijalog sa Prištinom."Želimo da dijalog bude ozbiljan i da vodi ka kompromisnom rešenju. Srbija je spremna za kompromis ali nije i nikada neće biti spremna za ponižavanje sebe i svog naroda. I svog naroda na Kosovu i Metohiji i naroda u celini. Nikada nismo isticali bilo kakve ekstremne zahteve, niti ono što znamo da niko neće prihvatiti, zato smo pominjali kompromis", rekao je Vučić nakon sastanka sa specijalnim izaslanikom Stejt departmenta za Zapadni Balkan Metjuom Palmerom.Vučić je naveo da greše i oni medju Albancima i u delu medjunarodne zajednice koji smatraju da je moguće da se pritiskom Srbija natera da prihvati bilo šta suprotno svojim nacionalnim interesima, jer je tako nešto nemoguće.On je rekao da je sa Palmerom imao otvoren i iskren razgovor i da je zadovoljan sadržajem tog razgovora."Razmotrili smo sva naša sporna pitanja i razlike izmedju nas i odlučni smo da pronalazimo rešenja koja bi značila bolje odnose izmedju SAD i Srbije. Jedna od važnih stvari je unapredjenje bilateralnih odnosa sa SAD i ja koristim priliku da još jednom pozovem američkog predsednika Donalda Trampa da poseti Srbiju. Nijedan američki predsednik od Džimija Kartera 1980. godine nije posetio Srbiju i to bi bio snažan impuls razvoju naših odnosa", rekao je predsednik Srbije.Vučić je rekao da je opšte poznato da su po pitanju Kosova i Metohije stanovišta različita, ali da je zahvalan Palmeru što je bio spreman da čuje ono što Beograd misli."Cenimo podršku našem evropskom putu. O svim pitanjima koja su suprotna i koja umeju da zabole otvoreno sa govorio sa Palmerom", rekao je on i dodao da o nekim detaljima neće govoriti u javnosti iz pristojnosti prema gostu i zbog diplomatskih pravila.On je dodao da je i Palmer njemu rekao ono što se Americi ne svidja u srpskoj politici a da su u razgovoru mnoge stvari razjašnjenje.Specijalni izaslanik za Zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer izjavio je u Beogradu da je važno da se na Kosovu poštuju rezultati izbora, i da je sasvim jasno da je Srpska lista zadobila podršku velike većine Srba na Kosovu i pravo da budu predstavljeni u Vladi.Na konferenciji za novinare posle sastanka sa predsednikom Srbije Aleksandrom Vučićem, Palmer je odgovarajući na pitanja o izjavi Aljbina Kurtija da u Vladu neće zvati Srbe iz Srpske liste, rekao da je o tome razgovarao sa liderima na Kosovu uključujući Kurtija i istakao da je važno da Srbi imaju priliku da se izraze ne samo otvoreno u javnosti već i kroz politički proces.Komentarišući isto pitanje, Vučić je rekao da je uprkos pritiscima Srpska lista dobila ogromnu podršku Srba sa Kosova, jer kako je rekao "ti ljudi na drugačiji način doživljavaju Kosovo nego Rada Trajković, (Nenad) Rašić i (Slobodan) Petrović".Vučić je dodao da mu je jasno što su Trajković, Rašić i Petrović draži Amerikancima, jer kako je rekao, oni Kosovo doživljavaju kao nezavisno."Važno je ovo što je rekao Palmer, Srpska lista osvojila je više od 90 odsto glasova i ona mora da bude u vladi ukoliko želi, a tako kaže i njihov Ustav", rekao je Vučić.On je dodao da su Amerika, Francuska, Engleska i Nemačka podržale stvaranje vojske Kosova "jer im se može".Kako je rekao "može im se" i da dovedu Radu Trajković ako Kurti tako odluči, ali onda, dodao je, "nemojte da pričaju o vladavini prava".Odgovarajući na pitanje da ga deo javnosti kad saradjuje sa Amerikom naziva izdajnikom, Vučić je rekao da nije čuo zašto je izdajnik, te da je 95 odsto Srba sa Kosova glasajući za Srpsku listu pokazalo da ga ne smatra izdajnikom.Vučić je rekao da Srbija neće ulaziti u sukobe sa Amerikom jer bi tako "pokazala naivnost i glupost", već će sva pitanja rešavati na bilateralnom nivou, ne podilazeći ali razumevajući dokle može da ide.Palmer je rekao i da je odluka EU da ne dodeli datum za početak pristupnih pregovora Severnoj Makedoniji i Albaniji "istorijska greška"."To je po našem mišljenju istorijska greška i loša poruka regionu", rekao je Palmer i naveo da SAD žele evropsku perspektivu za Zapadni Balkan i da će raditi na tome da ubede lidere EU u to pre samita u Zagrebu.Palmer je izjavio da je s Vučićem razgovarao o političkoj situaciji ne samo u Srbiji već i u regionu.
text:
Vucic: Dialogue with Pristina in two three months. Palmer: We will work on EU enlargement

04 Nov 2019, 09:20

Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said he believes dialogue with Pristina will resume in two or three months soon. "We want the dialogue to be serious and lead to a compromise solution. Serbia is ready for compromise but is not and will never be ready for a compromise. humiliating ourselves and our people. And our people in Kosovo and Metohija and the people at large. We have never emphasized any extreme demands, nor what we know anyone will accept, so we mentioned a compromise, "Vucic said after meeting with Special Envoy State of the Western Balkans Department, Matthew Palmer. Vucic said that those among the Albanians and in the part of the international community are mistaken who think that it is possible to pressure Serbia to accept anything contrary to its national interests, because something is impossible. He said that had an open and honest conversation with Palmer and was pleased with the content of that conversation. "We have considered all of our contentious issues and the differences between us and we are determined to find solutions that would mean a better relationship between the US and Serbia. One of the important things is improving bilateral relations with the US and I take the opportunity to once again invite US President Donald Trump to visit Serbia. No US president since Jimmy Carter visited Serbia in 1980 and that would be a strong impetus to the development of our relations, "said Serbia's president. Vucic said that it is widely known that Kosovo and Metohija's views are different, but he is grateful to Palmer who was ready to hear what Belgrade was thinking. "We appreciate the support for our European path. He spoke with Palmer about any issues that are contrary and that can hardly openly speak, "he said, adding that he would not speak in public out of politeness to the guest and because of diplomatic rules. He added that Palmer also told him that America does not like Serbian politics without many things being discussed. Western Balkans Special Envoy Matthew Palmer said in Belgrade that it is important that the election results are respected in Kosovo, and that it is clear that the Serb List has won support of the vast majority of Serbs in Kosovo and the right to be represented in the Government. At a news conference after meeting with Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic, Palmer answered questions about Aljbin Kurti's statement that he would not invite Serbs from the Serb List to the Government, said that he had talked about it with leaders in Kosovo including Kurti and stressed that it was important for Serbs to have the opportunity to express themselves not only openly in the public but also through the political process.Comment to enter the same question, Vucic said that despite the pressures, the Serb List received overwhelming support from Kosovo Serbs, as he said "these people perceive Kosovo differently than Rada Trajkovic, (Nenad) Rasic and (Slobodan) Petrovic." Vucic added that he understands what Trajkovic, Rasic and Petrovic are more like to the Americans, because, as he said, they perceive Kosovo as independent. "What is important is what Palmer said, the Serb List won more than 90 percent of the vote and it must be in government. if he wants, and so does their constitution, "Vucic said. He added that America, France, England and Germany have supported the creation of the Kosovo army" because they can ". Trajkovic if Kurt decides so, but then, he added, "don't talk about the rule of law." Asked to be called a traitor by some of the public when he cooperates with America, Vucic said he had not heard why he was a traitor, and that 95 percent Kosovo Serbs vote Vucic said that Serbia would not enter into conflicts with America because it would "show naivety and stupidity", but would resolve all issues at the bilateral level, without approaching but understanding how far it could go. Palmer also said that the EU's decision not to set a date for the start of the accession talks with North Macedonia and Albania is a "historic mistake." "In our view, this is a historic mistake and a bad message to the region," Palmer said, stating that the US wants a European perspective on The Western Balkans will work to persuade EU leaders to do so before the Zagreb summit. Palmer said he had discussed with Vucic the political situation not only in Serbia but in the region.
